title: Emerging Markets Value?
text:
Despite the fireworks, I appreciate some substantive ideas. To these already mentioned I will add: SFENX (which is in the large value style box, cheap, and sub-advised by Research Affiliates); Though not exactly an EM value option, VMMSX (Vanguard’s actively managed EM option is in the Large Blend box (but close to the value side)); and PEFIX (sub-advised by Research Affiliates and uses the company’s “portable alpha” approach). Chang’s mention of SIVLX is also interesting since it lies in the Mid-Value style box for emerging markets, giving the fund a unique profile within the space.

I appreciate everyone’s input. Thanks to Yogi for the Barron’s connection with Rob Arnott. Personally, I hope to follow Arnott’s advice in the M* “Long View” podcast interview and will try to “average in” over time into Emerging Markets Value. It still seems that there is a place for some additional value strategies that are cheaply priced in the EM space.

I will most likely use SFENX since it is cheap and available to me on NTF platforms. Chang reminded me of my previous interest in SIVLX. I would like to get into this fund and wish it was also conveniently available on an NTF platform.
